question: According to the article, if the poorest 3.5 billion people in the world added all their money together, it would be _____ than all the money of the richest 85 people in the world.
Which of the following is NOT an example of a type of public transportation commonly used in cities?
Based on the article, which of the following groups would NOT be considered as “underprivileged”?
The article says, “It isn’t always as simple as ‘Try harder!’ or ‘Just get a better job!’” What does this mean?
answer: It may not be as easy for some groups of people to improve their lives as it is for others.

question: True or False? Based on the definition used in the article, social inequality refers to a situation where one group has an advantage over other groups because of differences in education, money or power.
Based on the example used for disabled workers, if twenty non-disabled people are unemployed, how many disabled people are likely unemployed?
True or False? The definition of social inequality used in the article refers to a situation where some groups have more advantages than others.
True or False? The answers to the group of questions at the beginning of the article are all False.
Based on the example used for disabled workers, if twenty disabled people are unemployed, how many non-disabled people are likely unemployed?
According to the article, people who can get to green spaces have _____ than those who cannot visit green spaces.
Based on the article, which of the following groups would NOT be considered as “privileged”?
True or False? The answers to the group of questions at the beginning of the article are all True.
According to the article, if the richest 85 people in the world added all their money together, it would be _____ than all the money of the poorest half of the people in the world.
Which of the following is an example of a type of public transportation commonly used in cities?
According to the article, the number of women elected to high governmental positions in Taiwan is _____ other places in Asia.
Which of the following is not an example of the “working poor” mentioned in the article?
answer: People who are employed and paid well enough that they can easily pay for their lifestyle.

question: According to the article, other places in Asia have _____ women elected to high governmental positions than Taiwan does.
According to the article, poorer people who can get to _____ can improve their health by as much as forty percent.
Which of the following is closest in meaning to the “working poor” mentioned in the article?
answer: People who are employed but paid such low wages that they cannot afford many of their basic needs.
